title: Critical Reflection and Writing Workshop for Strengthening Social Welfare Practice Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational social welfare theories and practical fieldwork experience
context.additional_context: Most learners are job seekers requiring critical thinking and report-writing skills that bridge theory and practice. Content must be optimized for smartphone-based learning environments.

learning_goals: Learners can analyze ethical dilemmas encountered in social welfare settings through a critical reflection model and describe them in approximately 500 characters.
Learners can write case study reports applying HBSE (Human Behavior in the Social Environment) theories according to APA style guidelines.
Through peer feedback and instructor-customized coaching, learners can improve the clarity of writing structure and logical consistency by over 80%.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
